summary: This memo discusses Abram Chayes and Samuel Wise, both connected to Lee Harvey Oswald's case. Chayes was involved in Oswald's return to the US from the Soviet Union and had security clearance for discussions on sensitive matters. Wise, possibly Samuel Griffin Wise Jr., was a counsel in the American Embassy in Moscow and was involved in a case similar to Oswald's. The memo also mentions Wise's past CIA application and associations with individuals of questionable loyalty.
title: THE LEE HARVEY OSWALD CASE #351.164
